citation.article-title: Chelatococcus daeguensis sp. nov., isolated from wastewater of a textile dye works, and emended description of the genus Chelatococcus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Chelatococcus daeguensis sp. nov.
Chelatococcus daeguensis (dae.gu.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. daeguensis of Daegu, Korea, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming rods (0.3–0.6×1.0–4.0 μm).
Colonies on TSA are circular, convex, smooth, glistening, moderate yellow in colour and 0.7–1.0 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 37 °C.
Growth occurs at 20 and 51 °C, but not at 15 or 52 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7.0–7.5; growth occurs at pH 5.5 and 10.0, but not at pH 5.0 or 10.5.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–5 % (w/v) NaCl, with optimal growth at 0–1.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Anaerobic growth does not occur on TSA, but occurs on TSA supplemented with nitrate.
The major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are C18 : 1ω7c and C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c.
Major polar lipids are phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, two aminolipids and two unidentified phospholipids.
sym-Homospermidine, spermidine and putrescine are major polyamines.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 68.3 mol% (determined by HPLC).
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain, K106T (=KCTC 12979T =CCUG 54519T), was isolated from wastewater of a textile dye works at Daegu, Korea.
